org.springframework.cloud.gcp.pubsub.core

Class PubSubTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.cloud.gcp.pubsub.core.PubSubTemplate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, PubSubOperations

    public class PubSubTemplate
extends Object
implements PubSubOperations, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
    Default implementation of PubSubOperations.

    The main Google Cloud Pub/Sub integration component for publishing to topics and consuming messages from subscriptions asynchronously or by pulling.

    Author:
    Vinicius Carvalho, João André Martins, Mike Eltsufin, Chengyuan Zhao

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PubSubTemplate(PublisherFactory publisherFactory, SubscriberFactory subscriberFactory)
      Default PubSubTemplate constructor that uses SimplePubSubMessageConverter to serialize and deserialize payloads.

      • PubSubTemplate

        public PubSubTemplate(PublisherFactory publisherFactory,
                      SubscriberFactory subscriberFactory)
        Default PubSubTemplate constructor that uses SimplePubSubMessageConverter to serialize and deserialize payloads.
        Parameters:
        publisherFactory - the Publisher factory to publish to topics
        subscriberFactory - the Subscriber factory to subscribe to subscriptions

      • subscribe

        public com.google.cloud.pubsub.v1.Subscriber subscribe(String subscription,
                                                       com.google.cloud.pubsub.v1.MessageReceiver messageReceiver)
        Description copied from interface: PubSubOperations
        Add a callback method to an existing subscription.

        The created Subscriber is returned so it can be stopped.

        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface PubSubOperations
        Parameters:
        subscription - the name of an existing subscription
        messageReceiver - the callback method triggered when new messages arrive
        Returns:
        subscriber listening to new messages

      • pull

        public List<AcknowledgeablePubsubMessage> pull(String subscription,
                                               Integer maxMessages,
                                               Boolean returnImmediately)
        Description copied from interface: PubSubOperations
        Pull a number of messages from a Google Cloud Pub/Sub subscription.
        Specified by:
        pull in interface PubSubOperations
        Parameters:
        subscription - the subscription name
        maxMessages - the maximum number of pulled messages
        returnImmediately - returns immediately even if subscription doesn't contain enough messages to satisfy maxMessages
        Returns:
        the list of received acknowledgeable messages

        Parameters:

        maxMessages - the maximum number of pulled messages

        Returns:
        the list of received messages

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        subscription - the subscription name
        Returns:
        a received message, or null if none exists in the subscription

      • ack

        public void ack(Collection<AcknowledgeablePubsubMessage> acknowledgeablePubsubMessages)
        Description copied from interface: PubSubOperations
        Acknowledge a batch of messages. The method will group the messages by subscription name and acknowledge them in batches if possible.
        Specified by:
        ack in interface PubSubOperations
        Parameters:
        acknowledgeablePubsubMessages - messages to be acknowledged

      • nack

        public void nack(Collection<AcknowledgeablePubsubMessage> acknowledgeablePubsubMessages)
        Description copied from interface: PubSubOperations
        Negatively acknowledge a batch of messages. The method will group the messages by subscription name and acknowledge them in batches if possible.
        Specified by:
        nack in interface PubSubOperations
        Parameters:
        acknowledgeablePubsubMessages - messages to be negatively acknowledged
